meanings.definition: A sensation of tingling, pricking, or numbness in the skin.
meanings.sent1: After sitting cross-legged for too long, I experienced paresthesia in my foot.
meanings.sent2: The doctor explained that paresthesia can occur when blood flow is restricted.
meanings.sent3: Feeling paresthesia in my hand after holding my phone for hours made me laugh.
meanings.sent4: The paresthesia in her arm was like tiny ants crawling under her skin.
meanings.sent5: The paresthesia in his leg was so intense, it felt like a thousand needles poking him.

meanings.definition: An abnormal sensation, typically tingling or pricking, caused by pressure on or damage to peripheral nerves.
meanings.sent1: The cyclist's paresthesia in his fingers was due to prolonged pressure on the handlebars.
meanings.sent2: Paresthesia in the feet can be a sign of nerve damage.
meanings.sent3: Experiencing paresthesia in my toes after wearing tight shoes all day was quite amusing.
meanings.sent4: The paresthesia in her back was like a warning sign of impending discomfort.
meanings.sent5: The sudden paresthesia in his arm felt like a mysterious signal from his nerves.
